metadata.Title: CVE-2021-26931 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel 2.6.39 through 5.10.16, as usedin Xen. Block, net, and SCSI backends consider certain errors a plain bug,deliberately causing a kernel crash. For errors potentially being at leastunder the influence of guests (such as out of memory conditions), it isn'tcorrect to assume a plain bug. Memory allocations potentially causing suchcrashes occur only when Linux is running in PV mode, though. This affectsdrivers/block/xen-blkback/blkback.c and drivers/xen/xen-scsiback.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-26931` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 5.15.0-25.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 5.15.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 5.15.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 5.15.0-1002.4
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 5.15.0-1005.5
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 5.15.0-24.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-24.24
No subscription required
